title: Green victory shows insurgent parties are here to stay
partialText: The party's historic win in Gorton and Denton by-election is clearest sign yet of changing political landscape.

title: Soham killer Huntley still in hospital after attack using makeshift weapon
partialText: Huntley, who is serving a life sentence for murdering two schoolgirls, has significant head trauma, the BBC understands.

title: Why are Afghanistan and Pakistan fighting?
partialText: The two sides have different versions of how and why the deadly dispute began.

title: UK withdraws Tehran embassy staff as US-Iran tension sparks concern across region
partialText: The US embassy in Israel has also told some non-emergency staff they can leave the country if they wish.

title: How Hollywood and Maga aligned over Warner Bros deal
partialText: Paramount beats Netflix to the major deal, pleasing figures in DC and LA alike, the BBC's culture and media editor writes.

title: US Olympian says 'I would never say that' after White House AI video shows him insulting Canada
partialText: USA men's ice hockey player Brady Tkachuk distances himself from an AI-enhanced White House video in which he appears to disparage Canadians, saying "those words would never come out of my mouth".

title: Man arrested after Winston Churchill statue defaced with graffiti
partialText: The statue of the former prime minster at Westminster was vandalised with slogans daubed in red paint.

title: I hugged my daughter's killer as we cried together in prison
partialText: Chloe's mum visited her drug-driver killer Keilan Roberts in jail and says he will live with the guilt forever.

title: Ghosts TV sitcom to be brought back to life as a feature film
partialText: Ghosts: The Possession of Button House will see the return of the show's writers, creators and stars.

title: From plumber to Parliament, who is the Green Party's new MP?
partialText: Spencer marked her victory by apologising to customers for potentially having to cancel work due to her Westminster move.

title: Reform UK reports by-election 'family voting' concerns to police
partialText: It comes after election observers raised concerns about "extremely high" levels of family voting.

title: Sir John Curtice: The future of British politics is more uncertain than ever
partialText: Not only did Hannah Spencer become the first Green to win a by-election, she won it well.

title: Starmer says he will fight on after by-election defeat to Greens
partialText: The result - in a seat Labour has held for nearly 100 years - has renewed criticism of Sir Keir's leadership from Labour MPs.

title: Chris Mason: Green Party win will prompt soul searching within Labour
partialText: The prime minister is facing questions about whether Labour's focus on Reform  left them exposed among some of their regular supporters.

title: Watch: How Green Party victory unfolded
partialText: Labour, which took the Greater Manchester seat with more than 50% of the vote in 2024, was pushed into third place.

title: Six planets to be visible at same time in celestial 'parade' - here's how to see them
partialText: Six planets - Mercury, Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, Uranus and Neptune - will all be visible in the night sky.

title: Why Trump means the Cuban Revolution faces its biggest threat yet
partialText: Will a worsening internal crisis create the conditions for the Cuban Revolution to unravel from within?

title: Olivia Dean's radiant show warms Manchester up for the Brits
partialText: The star, nominated for five prizes at the Brits, plays a low-key gig to get Manchester in the mood.

title: Why you can't get a signal at festivals and sports matches
partialText: Connecting up music and sports events to the internet is a massive undertaking.

title: The AI videos supercharging Russia's online disinformation campaigns
partialText: Security experts have warned that Western governments are poorly equipped to counter a new frontier of online disinformation.

title: How Ghislaine Maxwell brought Bill Clinton into Epstein's orbit
partialText: Documents in the Epstein files reveal how Maxwell nurtured the connection between the two men after Clinton left the White House.

title: Weekly quiz: Which baby monkey broke the internet's heart?
partialText: How much attention did you pay to what happened in the world over the past seven days?

title: Waitrose to suspend mackerel sales due to overfishing concerns
partialText: The supermarket chain says it will stop sourcing fresh, chilled and frozen mackerel by 29 April.

title: Government to give go-ahead for £1bn defence helicopter deal
partialText: The chancellor has stepped in to protect jobs at the helicopter manufacturer in Somerset, the BBC understands.

title: Gregg Wallace drops personal data claim against BBC
partialText: Court documents state the claim against the BBC and BBC Studios has been "discontinued".

title: Taking collagen keeps skin more elastic but won't stop wrinkles, say scientists
partialText: The new review brings together the strongest evidence to date on collagen supplementation, say experts.

title: CPS loses bid to overturn Quran-burner's acquittal
partialText: Hamit Coskun's conviction was overturned last year, a ruling the CPS sought - and failed - to reverse.

title: Spanish opposition calls for disgraced ex-monarch to return from exile
partialText: The 88-year-old Juan Carlos should spend his last years in dignity, the leader of Spain's main opposition party says.

title: Walkers' bodies found on ridge near the summit of Wales' highest mountain
partialText: Jayden Long, 19, and Eddie Hill, 20, from Norfolk, were found on a Crib y Ddysgl, near Wales’ highest mountain.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: By-Electioncast: Greens Win Gorton and Denton
partialText: Hannah Spencer is the new Green MP for Gorton and Denton.

title: Trump's big, long, State of the Union speech
partialText: Can the president’s record breaking speech change voters’ minds ahead of the midterms?

title: Award-winning short thriller set on a farm
partialText: Jamie, Ruth's son, threatens to kill his parents if they don't give him part of the farm.

title: Patrick Swayze and Keanu Reeves star in this action thriller
partialText: An undercover cop pursuing a gang of bank robbers is seduced by the LA surf scene.

title: Chelsea v PSG, Man City v Real & Newcastle v Barca in Champions League last 16
partialText: Chelsea will play holders Paris St-Germain in the Champions League last 16 while Manchester City will face Real Madrid in the knockout stages for a fifth straight season.

title: Prem relegation scrapped from 2026-27 season
partialText: Traditional promotion and relegation to and from the Prem will be scrapped from the 2026-27 season as landmark changes to the English game are voted through.

title: Cadillac and Audi - the same ambition but two very different projects
partialText: Cadillac and Audi enter F1 with the ultimate goal of becoming world champions. Both know they have some way to go before achieving that aim.

title: 'Borthwick relaxed but defiant amid England Six Nations slide'
partialText: Instead of asking what has gone wrong for England in the Six Nations, the question is more why has it gone wrong?

title: Gordon needs to stay 'fully focused' after Arsenal talk - Howe
partialText: Head coach Eddie Howe has urged Anthony Gordon to stay "fully focused" after the Newcastle United forward was linked with a move to Arsenal.
